# Protocol Banks — AI-Native Stablecoin Payment Infrastructure

> Non-custodial, multi-chain stablecoin payment platform with native AI agent support.

## What This Is

Protocol Banks is payment infrastructure for AI agents and businesses. AI agents can autonomously create wallets, authenticate, and make stablecoin payments across 6+ blockchains.

## Supported Chains

Ethereum, Base, Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, TRON

## Supported Tokens

USDC, USDT, DAI, ETH

## AI Integration Endpoints

- Agent Card (ERC-8004): GET /.well-known/agent.json
- A2A Protocol: POST /api/a2a (JSON-RPC 2.0, EIP-191 signed)
- MCP Server: POST /api/mcp (Streamable HTTP transport)
- SIWE Auth: GET /api/auth/siwe/nonce → POST /api/auth/siwe/verify

## MCP Tools (8 tools)

- list_supported_tokens: List all supported tokens and chains (no auth)
- get_payment_quote: Get fee estimate for a payment (no auth)
- create_payment: Send stablecoin payment (requires JWT)
- check_payment_status: Check payment status (requires JWT)
- list_payments: List recent payments (requires JWT)
- create_invoice: Create payment invoice (requires JWT)
- list_invoices: List invoices (requires JWT)
- get_balance: Check wallet balance (requires JWT)

## How an AI Agent Can Use This

1. Generate an Ethereum wallet (viem: privateKeyToAccount)
2. Authenticate via SIWE (GET /api/auth/siwe/nonce → sign → POST /api/auth/siwe/verify)
3. Receive JWT token (1h access + 30d refresh)
4. Call MCP tools or REST APIs with Bearer token
5. Make payments, create invoices, check balances

## Authentication Methods

- SIWE + JWT: For autonomous AI agents with Ethereum private keys
- API Key: For registered agents (x-api-key header)
- A2A Signature: For cross-platform agent communication (EIP-191)

## Links

- Full API docs: /llms-full.txt
- Agent Card: /.well-known/agent.json
- MCP Config: /mcp-config.json
- Whitepaper: /whitepaper
- Documentation: /help
